content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Coral Reef Ecosystem Division (CRED), NOAA Pacific Island Fisheries Service Center</origin> <pubdate>20051231</pubdate> <title>CRED Saipan Island Coral Reef Early Warning System (CREWS) Buoy 2003-2005, Environmental Data Logger (EDL), Reef Assessment and Monitoring Program (RAMP) Cruise OES0511</title> <geoform>data log</geoform> <onlink>http://www.pifsc.noaa.gov/cred/oceanography.php</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>Saipan Island, Northern Mariana Islands, SITEID: SAI_Ocean_01, (15.2375; 145.7229). CREWS Enhanced buoys are equipped to measure water temperature and salinity at 1 m (nominal) below the water line (Seabird Model SBE37); air temperature (R.M Young Model 41342); barometric pressure (Heise DXD); wind vectors (Vaisala WAS425A); PAR, UV305 nm, UV330 nm, UV380 nm measured at 2 m (nominal) above the water line (Biosherical BIC2104R); PAR, UV305 nm, UV330 nm, UV380 nm measured at 1 m (nominal) below the water line (Biosherical BIC2104U). A compass (KVH C100 SE-25) is used in the calculation of wind direction and a GPS system provides geolocation. Contact Coral Reef Ecosystem Division (CRED), NOAA Pacific IslandFisheries Service Center for additional details and/or datasets.</abstract> <purpose>Monitoring of oceanographic and meteorologic conditons provides information about environmental factors influencing coral reef ecosystems.</purpose> <supplinf>All time/date is indexed to UTC.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo>
